  take ... off ...:    take an object off the machine
  exit:                exit the game

- All objects can be either on the machine or on the floor.

There are also 4 objects scattered around the room. You observe them: object 0 is on the floor, object 1 is on the floor, object 2 is on the floor, object 3 is on the floor. 

The machine hums softly in front of you, seemingly waiting. The light on the machine is currently off. You wonder if there is a relationship between the objects and the machine.
> put 0 on machine
0 is not a recognized object. The light on the machine is currently off.

> put object 3 on machine

You took object 3 off of the machine. The light on the machine is currently off.
> put object 3 on machine
You put object 3 on the machine. The light on the machine is now on.
> exit

Then, removing object 0 didn't turn it off, but removing object 3 did. Then putting 3 back on turned it on again.

So, when all four were on, the machine was on. Then after taking 0 off, it stayed on. That suggests that 0 isn't necessary once the machine is on. But when 3 was removed, the machine turned off even though 1, 2, and maybe 0 were on? Wait, no: after putting all four on, machine is on. Then take 0 off, machine remains on. Then take 3 off, machine turns off. So when 3 is removed, even if others are present, the machine turns off. That suggests that 3 is critical. Then putting 3 back on alone turns it on. So maybe the rule is that the machine turns on if and only if object 3 is on it. 

But wait, when they first added 3, the machine turned on. But when they added all four, the machine was on. Then removing 3 turned it off. So perhaps object 3 is the only blicket. Because even when other objects are present, the presence of 3 is required. 

What about object 2? When object 3 was on the machine with others, the machine was on. But after removing 0 and leaving 1,2,3 on, machine stayed on. Then removing 3 made it turn off, even though 1 and 2 were still there. So 1 and 2 don't contribute. Therefore, object 3 is the only blicket, and the rule is that the machine turns on when at least one blicket (object 3) is on it. So object 2 is not a blicket. Therefore, the answer is False.
